instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Is it safe to boot a Macbook without the heatsink?
threads.message:
I always put the heatsink back on logic boards before testing a computer, am I wasting my time?  
Is it generally safe to boot without the heatsink mounted?

threads.title: Is it safe to boot a Macbook without the heatsink?
threads.message:
No.

I don't think the CPU will directly destroy itself but it is definitely not good and can shorten the lifespan of the cpu.

Question is why are you removing the heatsinks though? You can keep them on unless there is a part you need to reach right underneath it

threads.title: Is it safe to boot a Macbook without the heatsink?
threads.message: At some point it goes in the ultrasonic, I assume thermal paste doesn't play well with it.

threads.title: Is it safe to boot a Macbook without the heatsink?
threads.message:
Oh yeah obviously, I was assuming you meant while you were trying to repair the device.
Get the heatsink off and remove the thermal paste before throwing it into the ultrasonic. Just put it back on before you start the system

threads.title: Is it safe to boot a Macbook without the heatsink?
threads.message: No you do not boot a board without a heat sink unless for quickly checking it it gives display.
